sub_title: Research Specialist|Innovations| Gender Based Violence|Social Behavioural Change| MSMEs| Youth|  Gender|
summary:
Tarisai is an experienced research, monitoring and evaluation professional with over 10 years’ experience in conducting project/program evaluations. His expertise lies in the fields of public health, education, micro, small and medium enterprises and livelihoods. He also has vast experience in collaborating with implementation partners, government ministries, community leaders in various districts. He is well versed with the core humanitarian standards of practice and is proficient in the use of Excel, PowerPoint, SPSS and Nvivo. I  also have proven experience of delivering proven results within time and budget  constraints. A servant leader, adept at identifying problem areas to drive process improvements and bottom line gaps. 

Key Competences
Qualitative research
Data Analysis
Participatory research
Report writing
Data Collection
Scientific Article Writing
Process Evaluations
Community Engagement

Data Analysis
NVivo
SPSS
Excel

Methods
Implementation Science Research
Process Evaluation
Surveys
Formative research

Key Achievements
Research Publications
Conference Presentations
Process Evaluation Reports
Mentorship of Junior Researchers 

Please contact me on my email  (tarysai1@gmail.com) to find out how I may add value to your next research project

profile_positions.company: University of South Africa/Universiteit van Suid-Afrika
profile_positions.description:
Publishing articles for the Africa Union Agenda 2063 Research Project. Over the past 3 years i have published 6 articles and I conference paper; 

1)	Manyati, T.K and Mutsau, M. (2021). Exploring the effectiveness of Telehealth interventions for diagnosis, contact tracing and care of Corona Virus Disease of 2019 patients in sub Saharan Africa: A rapid review. https://doi.org/10.1007/s12553-020-00485-8

2)	Manyati, T.K and Mutsau, M. (2021). Leveraging green skills in response to the COVID 19 crisis: A Case Study of Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) in Harare, Zimbabwe (Journal for Small Enterprises in Emerging Economies)

3)	Manyati, T.K and Mutsau, M. (2020) A systematic review of factors that hinder the scale up of mobile health (mhealth) technologies in antenatal care in sub Saharan Africa. African Journal for Science, Technology, Innovation and Development. DOI: 10.1080/20421338.2020.1765479

4)	Manyati, T.K and Mutsau, M. (2020) Factors that limit the Development, Prototyping and Adoption of Informal Innovations: Lessons for Policy Makers. African Journal for Science, Technology, Innovation and Development. DOI: 10.1080/20421338.2020.1747797

5)	Manyati, T.K and Mutsau. M (2019) Solving local needs through Innovations: Small and Medium Enterprises in Harare, Zimbabwe. Africa Insight. Vol 49. No 1. 1-17

6)	Manyati, T.K and Mutsau M (2019) Exploring technological adaptation in the informal economy: A case study of innovations in small and medium enterprises (SMEs). African Journal for Science, Technology, Innovation and Development. Vol.7. 1-7. 0772 891 778

Conference Presentation

1)	Manyati, T.K and Mutsau, M (2019) Exploring the factors that limit the development, adoption and diffusion of innovations: A case study of informal metal manufacturers in Harare, Zimbabwe. Paper presented at the Trade and Industrial Policy Strategy (TIPS) Forum, Pretoria, 29-20 May 2019.

profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

company.name: The Centre for Sexual Health and HIV/AIDS Research Zimbabwe (CeSHHAR Zimbabwe)

profile_positions.company: The Centre for Sexual Health and HIV/AIDS Research Zimbabwe (CeSHHAR Zimbabwe)
profile_positions.description:
•	Prepared and secured 2 study approvals and 2 study extensions from the  Medical Research Council of Zimbabwe and the Research Council of Zimbabwe
•	Assisting with design of data collection tools, logical frameworks, project indicators for results based M & E. 
•	Developing monitoring and evaluation operating plans for data collection by project staff
•	Facilitation of programme related trainings e.g. staff training on good quality data collection, transcribing recordings, and support the analysis and quality control of data
•	Conducting routine monitoring of the program on a quarterly basis 
•	Supported the development of the system to manage qualitative data and information, data filing and archiving and facilitating use by project staff. 
•	Participated in the process evaluations for the male circumcision project in 5 districts that helped to inform male circumcision demand creation in Zimbabwe and other HIV priority countries in Africa. 
•	Led the project staff in Zvimba and Gokwe North districts that supervised and evaluated the implementation of the new demand creation tool by 50 interpersonal agents (IPC agents) 
•	Participated in the compiling of 3 presentations for district meetings and to technical committees such as the Technical Working Group (TWG) and the Technical Advisory Group (TAG)
•	Contributed in writing progress reports such as monthly reports and documentation of lesson learnt, promising and best practices, identifying trends, issues, potential learnings, gaps and success stories over a 2 year period to inform the male circumsion program implementation and quality 
•	Participated in the evaluation of the sustainability models for the male circumcision programme pilot districts  that were implementing the voluntary medical male circumcision sustainability model for adolescents to inform program implementation by the Ministry of Health in Zimbabwe
profile_positions.title: Social Scientist

profile_positions.company: The Centre for Sexual Health and HIV/AIDS Research Zimbabwe (CeSHHAR Zimbabwe)
profile_positions.description:
•	Monitoring and evaluating of research related activities and the generation of research specific reports and summaries as applicable such as field notes and interview summaries
•	Collecting good quality qualitative and quantitative data according to standard operating procedures.
•	Data analysis, e.g. qualitative data coding.
•	Assisting with report writing for the qualitative findings for submission to the Project Director.
•	Evaluation findings informed the provision of sexual and reproductive health services provided by Population Services International cross different health care delivery sites in Zimbabwe
•	Contributed to the evaluation of the acceptability and feasibility of HIV self-testing in Zimbabwe
•	Timely preparation of resource requests and acquittals for project activities
•	Contributed to the data collection and analysis of cluster randomised trial of non-financial incentives to increase uptake of couples counselling and testing and of SMS reminders to promote linkage to prevention and care.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Social Scientist
